Attaching existing volumes to a server

If there are volumes that have not been attached to host, you can use this procedure to attach them.

Before you begin

  • Enable security on ports.

  • Add servers.

  • Create volumes.

Procedure

  1. To select one or more volumes to attach, click Storage Systems and then click a storage system tile for the storage system where you want to attach volumes.
  2. Click Volumes to view the inventory of all volumes.
  3. Select one or more volumes:

    • Select volumes that you want to attach to servers.

    • To attach a specific volume, click it to open the Volume <ID> page. You can also attach a single volume from the Volume details page for the specific volume.

  4. Click Attach Volumes.
  5. On the Attach Volumes page, select a server and click Next.
  6. The Host Mode is set by default to the server operating system. You can make a selection if needed. The server OS Type is provided when the server is added to Storage Advisor.
  7. By default, the Host Mode Option will depend on the Host Mode selection. Default values are set only for VMWARE EX and WIN EX host modes. The default for all other Host Modes is none.
  8. Select the LUN Alignment. By default, Storage Advisor uses the LUN number that is common to the servers. If attachment is to only one server, this setting has no effect.
  9. The Auto Create Zone is set to No by default. You can set it to Yes to automatically create zones.
  10. Optionally, select one or more Ports and one or more server WWNs. Make sure that the WWNs are valid in the environment and visible to the storage system. If the WWN-port pairs selected do not exist, Storage Advisor creates them.
  11. Click Submit.
